rtega_mnemonic:
窟窟RShole, cave, cellar, underground
  • bent 屈 hole 穴: entrance to cellar or cave
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 屈 indicates the sound; 穴 (cave) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
石窟 [ shí kū ]: rock cave; grotto; cliff caves (often with Buddhist statues)
贫民窟 [ pín mín kū ]: slum housing
魔窟 [ mó kū ]: lit. nest of devils; place occupied by sinister forces
狡兔三窟 [ jiǎo tù sān kū ]: lit. a crafty rabbit has three burrows; a sly individual has more than one plan to fall back on (idiom)
莫高窟 [ mò gāo kū ]: Mogao caves in Dunhuang 敦煌 , Gansu
purpleculture_tree:

    • 穴 [ xué ] cave, den, hole
    • 屈 [ qū ] to bend, to flex; bent, crooked, crouched
heisig_chinese_memo: A den is a kind of hole which an animal retreats to in order to prevent having to knuckle under (give in). &nbsp
heisig_constituent: cavern, hole, house, human legs, yield, flag, exit
koohiiStory1: After Osama blew a hole in NY, the counterreaction forced him to yield and retreat into caverns.
koohiiStory2: In "The Empire Strikes Back", the Milennium Falcon flies into a large hole, of what they think is a cavern, because they don´t want to yield to the forces of the Empire. Turns out it´s not a cavern at all, actually...

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: A den is a kind of hole which an animal retreats to in order to prevent having to knuckle under (give in). &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From the " acupoint ", the sound of " bending " indicates the soil chamber. "Jade Pian‧ Acupoint Department": "The cave, the room." "Mencius·Teng Wengong 2": "During the time of Yao, the water was retrograde and flooded in China. The snake and dragon lived there, and the people had no choice; the next one was the nest, the upper The one is the camp cave."

" Cave " also means cave. "Yu Pian‧ Acupoint Department": "Caves, acupoints." "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce IV": "Cunning Rabbit has three caves, only to avoid its dead ears."

" Ku " also refers to the gathering place of people or things. One of Jin Guopu's "Youxian Poems": "Jinghua Ranger Cave, where the mountains and forests are reclusive."

" Ku " also means cave dwelling and nesting. Jin Panyue "Xizheng Fu": "The pheasant is at Taibei, and the fox and rabbit cave is near the temple."

" Cave " also refers to dig (hole). The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Jialan: Wenyili": "The soil is very cold, living in caves."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " acupoint ", the sound of " bending " indicates the soil chamber.
humanum_full_description:
從「穴」，「屈」聲，表示土室。《玉篇‧穴部》：「窟，室也。」《孟子‧滕文公下》：「當堯之時，水逆行，氾濫於中國，蛇龍居之，民無所定；下者為巢，上者為營窟。」

　　「窟」也表示洞穴。《玉篇‧穴部》：「窟，穴也。」 《戰國策‧齊策四》：「狡兔有三窟，僅得免其死耳。」

　　「窟」也指人或物匯集處。晉郭璞〈游仙詩〉之一：「京華游俠窟，山林隱遯棲。」

　　「窟」還表示穴居、作巢。晉潘岳〈西征賦〉：「鷩雉雊於臺陂，狐兔窟於殿傍。」

　　「窟」亦指挖（洞）。北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記‧聞義里》：「地土甚寒，窟穴而居。」

從「 穴 」，「 屈 」聲，表示土室。《玉篇‧穴部》：「窟，室也。」《孟子‧滕文公下》：「當堯之時，水逆行，氾濫於中國，蛇龍居之，民無所定；下者為巢，上者為營窟。」 「 窟 」也表示洞穴。《玉篇‧穴部》：「窟，穴也。」 《戰國策‧齊策四》：「狡兔有三窟，僅得免其死耳。」 「 窟 」也指人或物匯集處。晉郭璞〈游仙詩〉之一：「京華游俠窟，山林隱遯棲。」 「 窟 」還表示穴居、作巢。晉潘岳〈西征賦〉：「鷩雉雊於臺陂，狐兔窟於殿傍。」 「 窟 」亦指挖（洞）。北魏楊衒之《洛陽伽藍記‧聞義里》：「地土甚寒，窟穴而居。」
From the " acupoint", the sound of " bending" indicates the soil chamber. "Jade Pian‧ Acupoint Department": "The cave, the room." "Mencius·Teng Wengong 2": "During the time of Yao, the water was retrograde and flooded in China. The snake and dragon lived there, and the people had no choice; the next one was the nest, the upper The one is the camp cave." " Cave" also means cave. "Yu Pian‧ Acupoint Department": "Caves, acupoints." "Warring States Policy‧Qi Ce IV": "Cunning Rabbit has three caves, only to avoid its dead ears." " Ku" also refers to the gathering place of people or things. One of Jin Guopu's "Youxian Poems": "Jinghua Ranger Cave, where the mountains and forests are reclusive." " Ku" also means cave dwelling and nesting. Jin Panyue "Xizheng Fu": "The pheasant is at Taibei, and the fox and rabbit cave is near the temple." " Cave" also refers to dig (hole). The Northern Wei Dynasty Yang Xuanzhi's "Luoyang Jialan: Wenyili": "The soil is very cold, living in caves."

窟字的基本解释

窟
kū
洞穴：石窟。狡兔三窟。窟窿。
人聚集的地方，多指歹徒聚集之所：匪窟。魔窟。

窟字的汉语字典释义

[①]［kū］
［《廣韻》苦骨切，入没，溪。］
“掘2”的被通假字。
(1)土室。
(2)指兽、虫、鱼等栖止的洞穴。
(3)泛指洞穴。
(4)指人或物汇集处。
(5)穴居；作巢。
(6)挖（洞）。
(7)见“窟窟”。
(8)通“崛”。高峻貌。
(9)通“屈”。穷尽；匮乏。

窟字的英文翻译

◎ 窟
hole

窟字的康熙字典解释

【午集下】【穴字部】　窟； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页866第33
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?苦骨切，音?。【篇海】窟，室也，孔穴也。【禮·禮運】昔者先王未有宮室，冬則居營窟。【左傳·襄三十年】鄭伯有爲窟室，而夜飮酒。【史記·專諸傳】公子光伏甲士于窟室中。【註】謂掘地爲室。　又山名。【北史·鄭義傳】隱居滎陽三窟山。【水經注】唐述山謂之唐述窟。又西一里有時亮窟。　又月窟，月所生。　又【戰國策】蘇秦特窮巷掘門。【註】掘卽窟，古字通。　又叶丘月切，音闕。【謝靈運·辭祿賦】解龜紐于城邑，反褐衣于丘窟。頖人事于一朝，與世物乎長絕。　又叶區乙切，音乞。【蘇軾·石炭詩】君知欲斫姦邪窟，楚國何曾斬無極。　【六書音義】亦作堀??。

窟字的源字形

窟字的起名意思

暂无。

cave
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［kū］
["Guangyun" is bitter, enters the river. ]
The false word for "dig 2" was passed.
(1) Earth room.
(2) It refers to a cave where beasts, insects, fish, etc. dwell.
(3) Generally refers to caves.
(4) Refers to the place where people or things gather.
(5) Burrowing; making a nest.
(6) Digging (holes).
(7) See "The Cave".
(8) Through "rising". Majestic appearance.
(9) Tong "qu". Exhausted; scarce.

Congxue, древние символы подобны пещерам; Congqu, Qu имеет значение изгиба, что означает, что пещеры часто изогнуты, но не прямые.

пещера

3) притон
